captions.text:
- I think one of the
things I am most proud of
is that I have never cheated on anyone.

- I believe that when
you're in a relationship
you should be committed to that person.
- I have cheated on someone, yeah.
How men feel about cheating
Have you ever been cheated on?

- Let me try to go back
to that place in my life.
I've tried to like bury...
I slowly noticed my girlfriend was
becoming more and more distant

and I try to pry and she
said nothing was wrong.

One day she was just
like, "I wanna break up."
And I was like, "What?"
Then I found out that she had been
seeing someone else for weeks.
- I was cheated on by a girl who I was
trying to restart a relationship with,

after we had been
separated for a little bit.
She couldn't stop
sleeping with her...
The guy that she was with
kind of in between us.
I guess her honesty
was appreciated but
made me feel awful.
- It was middle school, so who cares if
your heart gets broken in middle school.

Your hearts gonna get
broken in middle school.
That's gonna happen.
But my girlfriend
started seeing another guy
while she was at church camp.
While she was still dating me.
Which is like,

the most wrong thing you can
do at church camp, right?
Like, start seeing someone new.
Granted, he was more religious than me.
Maybe in the eyes of the lord
that was the right thing to do.
Have you ever cheated on someone?
- I went out to a club
with all my friends.
Met a girl there.
I was kissing her, dancing up on her.
Doing like all this stuff
and I was a few drinks in,
so I'm like, "All right, let's just take
"this to the next level."
I was like, you know, "Gimme a ride home."
She takes me in her car,
takes me to my place and I'm so drunk that
I forget that my girlfriend was living
with me at the time and I'm like,
"Holy crap, what do I do?"

- This girl and I were
"dating" exclusively
and I made out with someone else.
She wasn't like my girlfriend, well...
Okay, what it was, was she...
This was 10th grade and she was
not making out with me.
She would not make out with me.
She would only kiss me closed mouth
and I had this beautiful girl that
was willing to make out with me.
Sorry, I made out with her.
Have you ever been the other guy?
- I've definitely had,
how shall we say, older women
use me when I was younger.
I'm 30 now so that's not a problem

but in my early 20s I
definitely fell prey to that.
That's a real bad situation.

Don't ever get yourself
in a position where you're

potentially dealing with
somebodies angry husband.
Not recommended, I'm not gonna go
into anymore detail than that.

comments.author: blah ha

comments.text:
Guys take notes on some real shit, I'm about to say. If you're girlfriend 
seems to be getting distant from you, but insist that everything is okay, 
things are not okay. You need to have the courage to confront her about it, 
and break up with her. Listen, this is the 100% truth! If you wait around 
and let her confront you weeks, to months later not only will it hurt 
worse, but she will win, because she has already moved on, hence you will 
be left alone while she will be filling her oats with someone else.

Don't give her that satisfaction, be strong and let her know asap that, 
you're better than that and that she doesn't deserve someone like you, and 
that you've already moved on because you deserve to find happiness with 
someone that actually gives a damn.

 It's a game. I'm 33 years old I made the mistake one time in my life, and 
never did I make that same mistake. Once I started showing that I deserved 
better, I started getting better, and I found out I could choose what I 
desired. Also a lot of those girls that weren't worth my time came crawling 
back time after time after time, and it still happens to me. Those same 
girls, they still get the cold shoulder. They lost their chance, once a 
cheater always a cheater.﻿

then clearly you shouldn't even be in that relationship in the first 
place...﻿

One of the earliest things my gf asked me was "what would you do if you met 
someone else who was the perfect woman". After the flustering comment that 
that wasn't possible, I went on to clearly explain to her how much I hate 
cheating and cheaters, and that I would have to break up with her before I 
even considered getting close to this other woman. Her silence still haunts 
me to this day. I cannot comprehend the fucking state of mind the kind of 
assholes who even THINK about cheating are in. The only time I nearly beat 
the shit out of someone was when I heard they had cheated on my friend... 
good thing for him he ran better than me, because I'd probably have tried 
to kill him.﻿

you over, real men don't. How anyone thinks cheating is OK, I cannot 
comprehend...﻿

comments.author: swedishgirl95

comments.text:
Lol the guy at the end I can feel and agree with 100 percent. About 5 years 
back when I was 21 a girl who was a friend/manager of mine called me into 
the office at my work. We just bullshitted and talked around like normal 
then all the sudden out of nowhere, she reached over and shut the door. I 
still to this day swear I heard the door fully shut but lock but anyways 
the friend/ girl (who was about 28-30 looked at me and said "do you want a 
blow job?" I then looked at her and laughed jokingly (basically hoping she 
was joking because her current husband she just had a kid with was the 
brother of my best friend whom just got out of prison for his second 
violent felony.)  Anyways I looked at her and laughed nervously as if she 
were joking. She then looked at me and said "come on Austin..." She then 
started to unzip my pants started to pull it out. I then heard a knock at 
the door and using that for my excuse I stopped and backed up and said " I 
cant do this... I don't feel right about it being a friend of Mikes and his 
brothers best friend. Well basically later on since I was at the time using 
any and every drug I  could get especially opiates. Crystal (the girl 
mentioned earlier) mentioned she had a full bottle of prometh and codeine. 
It wasn't premo but it was better then a kick in the nuts and it would keep 
me well and if lucky a little bit high. So I showed up and drank it while 
sitting in front of her husband. She then left to go get some beer.  My 
luck being the way it always is, Mike her boyfriend got a text from the 
other line cook at work. He was the same guy who apparently started 
knocking on the door. Crystals husband had the same phone and he shared it 
with Crystal. This moron whom apparently had been snooping and listening by 
the office door decided to text her phone.... at that specific time... 
"Since you gave Austin head can I get some too?" So there I was standing in 
front of this two time violent, crazy, full blooded, Irish felon. All he 
did was look up at me and say "be honest with me right now! Did my wife 
suck your dick dude? Just tell me the truth? I wont hurt you. Just be 
honest with me. Petrified, even though I knew I was telling the truth I 
spilled the whole story in front of him. And although for a few minutes he 
looked like he was going to shoot or stab me, by the time I got to the end 
of the story he basically said  "Ok I believe you and I trust you. Thank 
you for being honest with me. I don't hate you but I hate Brian for texting 
what he did and I hate my wife for doing what she did." Basically he 
believed me because I told him that if I would have really let his wife do 
that I would have been much more secure and safe about it and went out to 
my car in the back parking lot and that I wasn't stupid and that I would 
never do that because he was my best friends brother and he was a friend 
too. But yeah that shit scared me that night a little bit. I basically 
wanted to share that story because I can relate to the last guy in the 
video with being a younger guy in his early twenties and being manipulated 
by slightly older, married women.﻿
comments.author: remsensor

comments.text:
"People with a healthy self esteem, who love and respect themselves, who 
love and respect other people, and who place a high value on loyalty would 
never cheat on a lover or spouce, even if they are unhappy, because it is 
not honorable or the right thing to do. They simply will end the 
relationship when they are unhappy instead of looking for fulfillment 
outside of the relationship. When a relationship ends, they take time to 
grieve and develop a sense of peace within themselves before they start 
dating again. People who cheat tend to be insecure, selfish, narcisstic, 
unhappy and have a low self worth. Since they have a low opinion of 
themselves, they project this on to other people and often feel no remorse 
or regret for hurting other people. Therefore, people who have a history of 
cheating, deception and a total lack of concern for the feelings of other 
people, should never be considered potential marriage partners, 
relationship material or someone to be in an exclusive relationship with. 
However, they can make great sex playmates, friends with benefits or people 
to have an open relationship with" ~ Coach Corey Wayne.﻿

comments.text:
It's important to note that before religion and the state came along humans 
were polygamous for thousands of years. Monogamy is actually a very recent 
concept and way of life. Tribes would treat every child as their own 
because no one was sure who's child it was. Maybe monogamy is the next 
evolutionary step but at the end of the day, people should do what 
satisfies them. Just be honest and upfront about it.﻿

comments.author: Snakebite420

comments.text:
There was a time when I would never dream of being unfaithful. Monogamy was 
the game and I was its most honest player. But I had this girlfriend who 
was just, like, chronically paranoid. She was insecure all the time, 
constantly accusing me of things I would never do. I had to break off 
countless friendships just to keep her happy. And every week she'd suspect 
someone else. And then when I told her I wasn't entirely straight she 
started after my guy friends too. Needless to say I got quite isolated in 
the course of that relationship, and irony of gut-wrenching ironies, it all 
ended when she cheated on me. I can't absolve myself of all responsibility 
for that - I was fed up with the way things were going between us, and I 
started becoming this terrible arsehole that I never envisaged myself 
being. I was spiteful and repressive and incessantly miserable. Long story 
short I drove her into the arms of another guy.
Anyway, nowadays I'm less about the monogamy and more about the honesty. If 
my partner said to me that s/he wanted to try it on with somebody else, I'd 
be more than sympathetic, and I'd do my best to reward that openness by 
happily negotiating through what we expect of one another in such a 
situation. Similarly, I'd expect the same level of understanding and 
facilitation from anyone I dated in the future and I would say as much 
right from the outset.﻿
